messages.message:
Hello, Russia! I hope we can both agree that peace between our nation's would be beneficial for the both of us?

I'd like to suggest that in return for letting me into Romania, you will have my support should you wish to expand into Scandinavia
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Hello, Russia! I hope we can both agree that peace between our nation's would be beneficial for the both of us?

I'd like to suggest that in return for letting me into Romania, you will have my support should you wish to expand into Scandinavia'.

messages.message: Hi Austria! I can definitely agree that peace between our nations would be good for both of us! Unfortunetly I can't agree to letting you have Rumania, as that is basically the back door into Russia. If you do try to take it, then there is going to have to be war between our two great countries. Also I don't see how you could really support me into Scandinavia... But that besides, I think we would both benifit from an alliance against Turkey. What do you think about that?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Hi Austria! I can definitely agree that peace between our nations would be good for both of us! Unfortunetly I can't agree to letting you have Rumania, as that is basically the back door into Russia. If you do try to take it, then there is going to have to be war between our two great countries. Also I don't see how you could really support me into Scandinavia... But that besides, I think we would both benifit from an alliance against Turkey. What do you think about that?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should not trust the message from Russia. The message seems contradictory as Russia denies granting you access to Romania, citing it as a backdoor threat, but then proposes an alliance against Turkey instead, which might not align with your intentions given their earlier stance on Romania.

messages.message:
In that case, I will keep out of Romania if you do the same, we'll keep it as a DMZ?

I'll admit my promise to help you with Scandinavia was a little optimistic, but do excuse me as I'll blame it on a tad too much Austrian beer.

We should keep an eye on Turkey, but I feel as though an alliance this early on will not leave us in the best of standing with the rest of Europe.
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'In that case, I will keep out of Romania if you do the same, we'll keep it as a DMZ?

I'll admit my promise to help you with Scandinavia was a little optimistic, but do excuse me as I'll blame it on a tad too much Austrian beer.

We should keep an eye on Turkey, but I feel as though an alliance this early on will not leave us in the best of standing with the rest of Europe.'.

messages.message: If were going to have an alliance, we should aim for blitzing turkey. It's the power triangle; Austria/Turkey/Russia. Only one of them is going to survive very long. Also, what is your relationship with Italy looking like? Just a note: I am willing to work out an agreement of who gets what part of the balkans, but I am taking Romania. It is essentially part of Russia and leaving it as a DMZ just will not do if Turkey goes for the Black Sea
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'If were going to have an alliance, we should aim for blitzing turkey. It's the power triangle; Austria/Turkey/Russia. Only one of them is going to survive very long. Also, what is your relationship with Italy looking like? Just a note: I am willing to work out an agreement of who gets what part of the balkans, but I am taking Romania. It is essentially part of Russia and leaving it as a DMZ just will not do if Turkey goes for the Black Sea'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should not trust the message from Russia. Their aggressive stance towards Turkey and insistence on taking Romania despite your proposal for a DMZ indicates a lack of commitment to peaceful coexistence with Austria.
